body_html:
I'm confused -- cholesky decomposition is defined to work on positive definite matrices for the definitions I looked up. What does pstrf do, then?

I've also seen some definitions say that the cholesky decomposition of a matrix produces L L* such that L is lower triangular with real and positive diagonal entries. What should be the result of the cholesky decomposition of [0]?
body_text:
I'm confused -- cholesky decomposition is defined to work on positive definite matrices for the definitions I looked up. What does pstrf do, then?
I've also seen some definitions say that the cholesky decomposition of a matrix produces L L* such that L is lower triangular with real and positive diagonal entries. What should be the result of the cholesky decomposition of [0]?
body:
I'm confused -- cholesky decomposition is defined to work on positive definite matrices for the definitions I looked up. What does pstrf do, then?

I've also seen some definitions say that the cholesky decomposition of a matrix produces `L L*` such that L is lower triangular with real and positive diagonal entries. What should be the result of the cholesky decomposition of `[0]`?
